info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 14 at 7:44PM MDT until July 14 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... South central Grant County in southwestern New Mexico... Northern Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico...
* Until 900 PM MDT.
* At 741 PM MDT, spotty showers continued to produce plumes of blowing dust along Lordsburg Playa. Meanwhile, a larger area of blowing dust east pushing towards Lordsburg from the east. This area will push towards the Arizona border through sunset, affecting Interstate 10 and portions of State Highway 9.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong winds up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 42.
Additional thunderstorm development is possible as outflow moves in from the east. Stronger storms could result in worse visibilities what is currently being observed.
Locations impacted include... Rodeo, Lordsburg, Cotton City, Hachita, Steins, Animas, Playas, Road Forks, Separ, Windmill, Lordsburg Playa, Granite Gap, Shakespeare, Pyramid Mountains, and Hachita Valley.
info.instruction: Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
